column5: Hi, I was wondering if anybody know of any good fishing lakes close to Toronto which has boat rental. The ones that I've been to are:Lake Chemong(Spelling?) in PeterboroughLake Scugog Lake SimcoeRice LakeIf so, could you please give me directions? Thanks!!
I hope when you get to Toronto you ask them about the HURRICANE that swept through their fair land and caused total destruction!!

Cowen,I used to go with a group to Stoney Lake, which is about 2 1/2 hours NE of Toronto. Pretty good walleye, SM/LM bass, and muskie. Tons of large bluegill. There are a couple of camps with cabins and boat and motor rentals there. We stayed at Little's Cottages. Talk to Percy. Directions are (I think) 401 East to Rt 7 North. Follow 7 north through Peterborough to Lakefield. Go through Lakefield and turn East on CR 28(?) about 10 miles to the lake. Good luck.Tim
